Dating: NEW KINGDOM (not before); 18TH DYNASTY ?; NEW KINGDOM (not after)
Name: Vase with handles
Description: This alabaster vase comes from the excavations of W. F. Petrie at El-Riqqeh. It is characterised by a oval belly provided with two handles , of which one is entirely damaged, by a round socle defined at the top by a collar and by a neck with a large rounded edge. The piece dates from the New Kingdom.
